Problem:
class EmailClient { constructor(server) { this.server = server; this.cache = []; } sendEmail(message, recipient) { if (this.server.isConnected()) { this.server.send(message, recipient); this.cache.push({message, recipient}); return true; } return false; } retrieveEmails() { if (this.server.isConnected()) { const emails = this.server.fetch(); this.cache = emails.concat(this.cache); return emails; } return []; } } class Server { constructor() { this.connected = true; } isConnected() { return this.connected; } connect() { this.connected = true; } disconnect() { this.connected = false; } send(message, recipient) { console.log(`Sending message to ${recipient}: ${message}`); } fetch() { console.log('Fetching emails'); return [{ message: 'Hello', recipient: 'user@example.com' }]; } }",

If the EmailClient's sendEmail method returns false, can we conclude the server is disconnected?
Explanation: sendEmail method checks the connectivity using server.isConnected() before attempting to send an email. The return value false primarily indicates a lack of server connectivity, since that’s the only condition under which sendEmail will directly return false without attempting to send the email.

List only distinct and meaningful causal relations. Do not provide any final answer to the question. Focus only on extracting the causal structure. Output strictly in JSON format: {"causal_relation": "A → B; C → D; ..."}.
causal_map: EmailClient.sendEmail() → EmailClient.server.isConnected(); EmailClient.server.isConnected() → EmailClient.sendEmail() returns false; EmailClient.server.isConnected() → EmailClient.sendEmail() returns true; EmailClient.server.send() → EmailClient.sendEmail(); EmailClient.server.fetch() → EmailClient.retrieveEmails(); EmailClient.retrieveEmails() → EmailClient.cache; EmailClient.cache → EmailClient.retrieveEmails(); Server.isConnected() → Server.send(); Server.isConnected() → Server.fetch(); Server.connect() → Server.isConnected(); Server.disconnect() → Server.isConnected();

causal_map_integration: If the EmailClient's sendEmail method returns false, it indicates that the server is not connected.
